'''Sam Bozzo''' (born February 15, 1969) is an [[United States|American]] [[film director]] and [[author]].
==Overview== Bozzo wrote, directed, and edited three short films. ''For Which It Stands'' (1990) was screened in the [[Sundance Film Festival]]. ''The Shadowed Cry'' (1992) was created as a Top 10 Director assignment for [[Project Greenlight]], run by [[Matt Damon]] and [[Ben Affleck]]. ''Holiday on the Moon'' (1994) won the [[TriggerStreet.com]] Short Film competition held at the [[Toronto International Film Festival]], has been screened on the [[Sundance Channel (United States)|Sundance Channel]] and is available on a compilation DVD ''Spooks and Creeps''. Bozzo won a 1994 CINE award for the film.<ref>[http://farm.imdb.com/Sections/Awards/CINE_Competition/1994 Holiday on the Moon CINE Eagle]</ref>
As a writer, his screenplay ''The Garden'' (2006) was produced by [[Stephen J. Cannell]],<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0436343/combined The Garden]</ref> three other screenplays were Quarterfinalists in the Nicholl Fellowship for Screenwriting,<ref>[http://www.oscars.org/nicholl/fellows/1998quarterfinalists.html Erika's Rose Nicholl Fellowship Quarterfinalist]</ref><ref> [http://www.oscars.org/nicholl/fellows/1999quarterfinalists.html Lusitania Nicholl Fellowship Quarterfinalist]</ref><ref>[http://www.oscars.org/nicholl/fellows/2000quarterfinalists.html Sweet and Sour Nicholl Fellowship Quarterfinalist]</ref> and Bozzo's novel ''Sweet and Sour'' (2006), a dark comedy based on his script of the same name, was published through Dragonmount at [[CafePress.com]].
Bozzo has finished two feature documentaries, one on [[Hacker (computer security)|hackers]] ([[Hackers Wanted]])<ref>[http://web.archive.org/web/20071018064053/http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0816690/ Can You Hack It? (2007)], Archived copy of currently deleted [[Internet Movie Database|IMDB]] page from the [[Internet Archive]].</ref> and the other ''Blue Gold: World Water Wars'', inspired by the book by [[Maude Barlow]] and [[Tony Clarke]].
